Swag.from sentence: We use this method to construct Swag : an adversarial dataset with 113 k multiple - choice questions .

pairs.from sentence: We start with pairs of temporally adjacent video captions , each with a context and a follow - up event that we know is physically possible .

state - of - theart language model.from sentence:
We then use a state - of - theart language model fine - tuned on this data to massively oversample a diverse set of possible negative sentence endings ( or counterfactuals ) .
Next , we filter these candidate endings aggressively and adversarially using a committee of trained models to obtain a population of de-biased endings with similar stylistic features to the real ones .

filtered counterfactuals.from sentence: Finally , these filtered counterfactuals are validated by crowd workers to further ensure data quality .
